main_definition: To carry out, execute or demonstrate a task, action, skill or piece of work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To execute a planned activity, especially in a professional context.
meanings_and_examples.example: The band will perform tonight at the local concert hall.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To carry out or fulfill an assigned task or duty.
meanings_and_examples.example: I have to perform my duties as the manager of this department.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To enact a play, musical, dance piece etc., typically on stage in front of an audience.
meanings_and_examples.example: The actors will perform Shakespeare's Hamlet next weekend.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To conduct or lead oneself or another person through actions and gestures, often as a form of communication.
meanings_and_examples.example: She used sign language to communicate with the deaf man during their meeting.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To accomplish a task efficiently and effectively, especially in sports or games.
meanings_and_examples.example: The team is expected to perform well in the upcoming match due to their rigorous training regimen.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To produce an intended result by means of skillful execution.
meanings_and_examples.example: His piano performance was so captivating that it received a standing ovation.
